metadata.title: Stochastic dynamics of an epidemics with recurrent spillovers from an endemic reservoir

abstract.original_text: Most emerging human infectious diseases have an animal origin. Yet, while zoonotic diseases originate from a primary reservoir, most theoretical studies have principally focused on single-host processes, either exclusively humans or exclusively animals, without considering the importance of animal to human transmission for understanding the dynamics of emerging infectious diseases.
